results.title: Hills of home
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Robert Sisk and Fred M Wilcox
results.brief_description: Starring everybody’s favourite dog, Lassie, this entertaining and enjoyable family film centres around a remote Scottish village and its only doctor (played by Edmund Gwenn) who decides to adopt Lassie. However unbeknownst to the doctor, Lassie has an aversion to water and even though the good doctor patiently tries to work her through this fear, it is not until Lassie is put to the test of saving the doctor’s life that the fear is finally overcome. Cast also includes Janet Leigh and Tom Drake.

results.title: Hillary ventures south
results.brief_description: A documentary chronicling a visit to Tasmania by Sir Edmund Hillary. He arrives, meets some dignitaries, surveys some national park areas to the south of Hobart, then joins a bushwalking club to scale Mount Mawson. The film focusses on what a thrill it is for these youngsters to climb alonside the man who scaled Everest. Hillary, the narrator tells us, says Tasmania has some of the greatest tramping country in the world.

results.title: Hilary and Jackie
results.creator_credit: Oxford Film Company, Andy Paterson, Nicolas Kent and Anand Tucker
results.brief_description: This is the story of two gifted sisters who grew up in England in the 1950s and competed for musical accolade and love. Hilary was a talented flautist, but it was her sister, Jackie, who was the musical genius who went on to become one of the greatest cellists of the 20th century, while Hilary chose a simple family life in the country. The film follows their sibling rivalry in musical competition and romance, and in spite of their differences they both share common emotions, including jealousy. As Jackie struggles with her rapid rise to fame, her journey would have incredible and devastating consequences on both hers and Hilary’s lives. Cast includes Emily Watson, Rachel Griffiths, James Frain and David Morrissey.

results.title: Highways in action
results.brief_description: Planning and execution of modern roads and bridges in Japan, showing advanced methods to cope with heavy urban traffic in Tokyo and designs for open country where appearance as part of the landscape is as important as function.

results.title: Highways challenge
results.creator_credit: Kingcroft Productions, John Kingsford-Smith and Jack Gardiner
results.brief_description: This film deals with Australia’s road problems. Describes how each member of the public is dependent upon road transport and points out that poor roads increase prices. Shows how cheaper methods of road transport can eventually be more costly. Suggests that the correct approach to the problem is lacking and offers a solution. Commentary by David Low.

results.title: Highway improvements
results.brief_description: Details of planning and improvements of Victorian state highways, including climbing lanes for slow traffic, duplicate pavements, elimination of railroad crossings and development of by-pass roads.

results.title: Highlights of the United Nations year 1947-48
results.brief_description: UNO’s activities during 1947-48 included: partition of Palestine; building a headquarters for UNO; combating a cholera outbreak in Egypt; sending wool from Australia to Poland; attending the funeral of Mahatma Ghandi; Mutual Aid Conference in India; truce in Indonesia; sending 2,500 displaced persons to Venezuela under IRO sponsorship; launching the International Children’s Emergency Fund plans to send 140 million pounds worth of food and clothing and medical supplies for use in Asia and Europe.

results.title: Highlights Edinburgh 1986 Commonwealth Games
results.brief_description: Ten days of vivid emotion, colour and competition are captured on this specially compiled video containing highlights of the X111th Commonwealth Games held in Edinburgh, Scotland. All ten sports are featured and there are many memorable moments as athletes achieve long hoped for success or experience the pain of defeat.
